findings.title: Unprotected approve function
findings.description: The approve function does not have any protection against unauthorized access.

findings.title: Unprotected transfer function
findings.description: The 'transfer' function is unprotected and can be exploited to withdraw Ether without proper authorization.

findings.title: Unprotected transferFrom function
findings.description: The transferFrom function is not protected and can be exploited by malicious actors.

findings.title: Unprotected increaseAllowance function
findings.description: The increaseAllowance function does not have proper access control, allowing unauthorized users to modify allowance.

findings.title: Unprotected decreaseAllowance function
findings.description: The decreaseAllowance function is unprotected and can be exploited by an attacker to drain user funds.

findings.title: Unprotected mint function
findings.description: The mint function is unprotected, allowing unauthorized users to mint tokens.

findings.title: Unprotected initialize function
findings.description: The initialize function is unprotected and can be called multiple times, potentially leading to unintended behavior.

findings.title: Unprotected renounceOwnership function
findings.description: The renounceOwnership function is unprotected and can be called by anyone, allowing them to renounce ownership of the contract.

findings.title: Unprotected transferOwnership function
findings.description: The contract owner has full centralized power to control the contract, which creates a risk of rug pull scams and centralization hacks.

findings.title: Potential reentrancy in _beforeTokenTransfer function
findings.description: The _beforeTokenTransfer function may be vulnerable to reentrancy attacks.

findings.title: Potential unauthorized script upgrade
findings.description: The smart contract allows unauthorized upgrades to its scripts.
